meanings.definition: The act of removing objectionable content from a text.
meanings.sent1: The expurgations in the book made it suitable for children to read.
meanings.sent2: The expurgations in the newspaper ensured it was appropriate for all audiences.
meanings.sent3: The expurgations in the novel turned a scandalous story into a family-friendly tale.
meanings.sent4: Her expurgations of unnecessary details from the report streamlined its readability.
meanings.sent5: The expurgations of violent scenes from the movie left only the heartwarming moments.

meanings.definition: The process of cleansing or purifying something by removing offensive material.
meanings.sent1: The expurgations of toxins from the water made it safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The expurgations of harmful chemicals from the air improved the quality of life in the city.
meanings.sent3: The expurgations of negative thoughts from her mind brought her peace and clarity.
meanings.sent4: His expurgations of bad habits from his routine led to a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The expurgations of clutter from the room created a more spacious and organized environment.
